headline.main: Duke Nalon, 87, Who Earned Pole Position At the Indianapolis 500 in 1949 and 1951

lead_paragraph: Duke Nalon, who twice started the Indianapolis 500 from the pole position, died Monday at an Indianapolis hospital. He was 87. Nalon first came to the Indianapolis Motor Speedway as a riding mechanic for Johnny Sawyer in 1937, when he took the rookie driving test but did not make the race. The next year, he qualified 33rd and finished 11th. He was 22nd and 15th in 1940 and 1941, then worked for Rolls-Royce as a mechanic on its fighter-plane engines during World War II.
abstract: Duke Nalon, former auto racing driver, dies at age 87 (S)
